title: How to Export Your IMDb Custom Lists to a CSV File

steps.title: Log in to https://www.imdb.com (if you haven't already).
steps.content: Log in to https://www.imdb.com (if you haven't already). Make sure that you log into the account that contains the list you want to export.

steps.title: Click the menu at the top-right corner.
steps.content: Click the menu at the top-right corner. It's the small downward-pointing arrow next to your name.

steps.title: Click Your Lists on the menu.
steps.content: Click Your Lists on the menu. All of your custom lists appear on this page. If you want to export your ratings list rather than a custom list, select Your ratings instead, and then skip to Step 4. To export a watchlist instead, click Your watchlist on the menu, and then Export this list link at the bottom-right corner of the list's contents. Now, skip to Step 7.

steps.title: Click the name of the list you want to export.
steps.content: Click the name of the list you want to export. This opens the list's contents.

steps.title: Click the three-dot menu ⋮.
steps.content: Click the three-dot menu ⋮ . It's three vertical dots right above the list (to the right of the list's name). A menu will expand. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Export on the menu.
steps.content: Click Export on the menu. The "Save as" window will appear.

steps.title: Select a saving location and click Save.
steps.content: Select a saving location and click Save . This saves your list as a CSV file, which can then be opened in a spreadsheet application like Excel or Google Sheets, and/or imported into other applications. Some applications that allow you to view the contents of a CSV file in an easy-to-read format are Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, LibreOffice Calc, and Numbers.
